page.title: 13TRANSPORT.
page.content: Walking is widely practised,for short distances. Cycling is inexpensive and popular and the roads are fairly flat. The most common means of transport is the motor car. Most people own cars; however,their use is declining because of high petrol prices of about{Â£2 a {gallon.}Taxis are used regularly. Trains run between Ipswich and Lowestoft via Woodbridge, Wickham Market, Saxmundham, Darsham, Halesworth, Beccles and Oulton Broad. There are{13 trains a day,}except at weekends. There is a bus connection at Halesworth but the times do not coincide. Buses run from Southwold to Bungay{4 {times a day}through Reydon, Blythburgh & Halesworth. Transport in this area is poor. The cut in bus services has contributed to the decline in the area It is becoming increasingly cut off.
